meanings.definition: To make less severe or intense
meanings.sent1: She tried to unmiter the argument by calmly explaining her point of view.
meanings.sent2: The doctor's prescription helped unmiter the pain in his knee.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand seemed to unmiter the tension in the room, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had the power to unmiter any sadness in his heart.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter's quick response helped unmiter the flames before they spread further.

meanings.sent1: The unmiter storm caused widespread damage to the town.
meanings.sent2: His unmiter determination to succeed impressed everyone around him.
meanings.sent3: The unmiter ice cream was too hard to scoop out of the container.
meanings.sent4: The unmiter rock stood firm against the crashing waves.
meanings.sent5: The unmiter wind blew fiercely, making it difficult to walk outside.

meanings.definition: A person who does not soften or lessen
meanings.sent1: She was known as the unmiter in the office, always sticking to the rules.
meanings.sent2: The unmiter of discipline made sure everyone followed the schedule.
meanings.sent3: The unmiter of jokes always had a witty comeback ready.
meanings.sent4: He was the unmiter of emotions, never showing any sign of fear.
meanings.sent5: The unmiter of decisions always had a clear plan in mind.
